nft-brand-booster.name: NFT Brand Booster
nft-brand-booster.description: Send NFTs via email or wallets. Build a whitelist, reward the most loyal users, grow your email list in exchange for rewards, or hand-pick who gets the drop.

content.title: About
content.p: Boost your visibility and grow your community with collectible NFTs.
Use this Simplet to drop branded NFTs that double as rewards, access passes, or referral incentives. Send them to emails or allow pre-approved wallets to mint—no technical setup required.

content.subtitle: How it works
content.p: Brand Booster gives you two ways to distribute NFTs:
content: Email Mint: Upload email addresses to send mint invites—perfect for onboarding newcomers.
Wallet Mint: Upload a wallet list to let selected users mint directly—ideal for loyalty rewards or whitelisted drops.

content.content: Manage everything through the admin dashboard and track who minted what.

content.subtitle: What you’ll need before you start:
content: Create an NFT collection using Apillon’s step-by-step [NFT Wizard](/dashboard/service/nft), keeping in mind that attendees will mint from that collection.
If you're using email, you’ll need your [SMTP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simple_Mail_Transfer_Protocol) details so you can send invites directly from your domain.

content.subtitle: What it’s made of:
content: Frontend: Built with Vue.js
Backend: Powered by Node.js and MySQL for data storage
Employs: Trusted Execution Environment (TEE) to keep your SMTP credentials safe

content.subtitle: How to deploy:
content: Frontend: Use Apillon GitHub integration for a quick auto-deploy directly from the [Apillon's Web3 Hosting](/dashboard/service/hosting). You can also run it locally or host it with any provider.

Backend: Use Phala Docker for a secure auto-deploy. You can also run it locally or with Docker—just configure your NFT and email setup [(see instructions on GitHub)](https://github.com/Apillon/nft-studio)

nft-wild-west.name: NFT Wild West
nft-wild-west.description: First-come-first-served NFTs. Run bold, experimental campaigns. Use memes, mystery, or chaos to go viral - and reward the fastest fingers.

content.title: About
content.p: Open up your drop to the wild—and let anyone mint.
This Simplet is perfect for open campaigns, wide outreach, or social drops. No emails. No wallet list. Just a public link anyone can use to claim your NFTs.

content.subtitle: How it works
content: A dashboard, where you’ll be able to track the minting stats for the NFT collection made with Apillon.
A public minting page, where anyone with the link can mint—first come, first served.

nft-event-experience.name: NFT Event Experience
nft-event-experience.description: Easy to claim, fun to keep. Create digital badges for your event attendees. Drop NFTs at the event or online and let people collect proof they attented.

content.title: About
content.p: Turn precious moments into lasting digital rewards with NFT Event Experience.

Create collectibles for your events, pack them with perks, or send them out as forever-digitized memorabilia for your attendees. NFTs can be minted on-site or reserved via email—perfect for rewarding loyal supporters and expanding your audience.

content.subtitle: How it works
content: An admin dashboard, where you create and manage events, track stats, and connect each event to an NFT collection made with Apillon.
A claim page, displayed at your event—a website with a changing QR code where attendees can mint or reserve NFTs on the spot.

content.subtitle: What you’ll need before you start:
content: Create an NFT collection using Apillon’s step-by-step [NFT Wizard](/dashboard/service/nft), keeping in mind that attendees will mint from that collection.

smtp.info: Add your SMTP settings so your emails are sent straight from your domain—no sketchy senders here.
smtp.help: *[SMTP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Simple_Mail_Transfer_Protocol) is a protocol that enables sending and receiving mail messages. If you don’t have an SMTP server of your own yet, use [resend.com](https://resend.com/)
smtp.skip: Skip email server setup for now. A default SMTP server will be pre-configured inside the Docker image. You can update the SMTP configuration later if needed.
smtp.warning: Don’t worry—your SMTP details are safe. Simplets run in a Trusted Execution Environment (TEE), which means your sensitive data stays protected. [Learn more](https://phala.network/confidential-computation-with-tee) about TEEs and confidential computing.
